properties.media:imagetext:
March
Nineteenth,
1 9 2 7.
Market
Street Railway Co.,
58 Sutter Sto,
San Francisco.
Gentlemen:
The City and County
of
San Francisco has leased from
the Mills Estate a tract of land on the Bay Shore,
opposite
Lomita Park, in
San Mateo County,
to be used as an air port,
The lease runs for three years with an option for
renewal
for two
additional years.
There is also a possibility that
this site will be selected as a permanent air port site.
We have made arrangements with the City of San Bruno for
a fresh water supply, and it will be necessary in order to make
a connection with their water
system to cross beneath the tracks
of your railroad near Lomita Park station.
I
am forwarding
herewith a blue print showing the location of the said water
pipe.
We would like to secure from your Company the right or
privilege
to maintain this water pipe in
the location as shown
on the accompanying plan.
I do not know if you have any form of
agreement covering a transaction of this kind, but if you have
I am sure it would be satisfactory to us.
We are anxious to have the air
port ready by the 5th of
May,
as there will be a
convention
of air men in San Francisco
at
that tine,
in
and I would appreciate your early consideration
this matter.
Very truly yours,
RIGHT OF WAY AGENT.
JJP: KH
375 City Hall.

properties.wof:name: correspondence: Joseph J. Phillips, Right of Way Agent for City and County of San Francisco
